topic.title: RBAC for Administrators
topic.shortdesc: The Couchbase Role-Based Access Control system allows a full administrator to specify, with fine granularity, the access-rights of other administrators; so ensuring that the activity of each is constrained to an appropriate area; in accordance with business-objectives, compliance-requirements, and current expertise.

section.title: Authorization for Full Administrators
section.p: The administrator who initially performs installation and configuration of Couchbase Server is granted full read-write access to the entire system. The user ID of this administrator can be either locally specified, or remotely, by means of LDAP.
Once basic system-configuration has been completed, the initial, full administrator is free to add additional administrators to the system, and specify their levels of access.

section.title: Adding Users
section.p: As full administrator, to add users (which in practice, means administrators) to Couchbase Server, use the Couchbase Web Console. Access the Dashboard, and left-click on the Security tab, on the vertical navigation-bar, at the left. This brings up the Security view, as follows:
To add a user, left-click on the + Add User control, at the right. The + Add User dialog now appears:
Add appropriate entires into the Username and Password fields. The Full Name field may be left blank. To specify one or more roles, left-click in the Role(s) field. This displays a pull-down menu:
To allocate the user a specific role, select the role from the pulldown menu, by left-clicking. The role now appears in the Roles(s) field, as follows:
To allocate one or more additional roles, repeat the procedure, by selecting from the pulldown menu (scrolling downwards if necessary). Accordingly multiple roles populate the Role(s) field:
These roles allow the user read-only permission on the entire Couchbase Server system, with read-write permission on the travel-sample bucket.
When you have finished allocating roles, left-click on Save. The Security view now appears as follows:
The new user is now represented in the main panel, with their allocated roles listed in the Roles column. Note that by left-clicking within the row, you display options for editing:

By left-clicking on Delete, you delete the user. By left-clicking on Edit, you return to the Manage User > testUser dialog, with the options to redefine username, full name, and roles. By left-clicking on on Reset Password, you bring up a dialog that allows you to redefine the user's password:
Note also that by left-clicking on a role, displayed in the Role column, you display a tool-tip, which provides information on the role's signifiance:
For a complete account of the roles you can allocate and their significance, see Administrative Roles.
